intro: Androsace coccinea, commonly known as the crimson sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Montiniaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually succulent and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to retain moisture in rocky or alpine environments. Androsace coccinea thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
